translated: Sutra of the Names of the Thousand Buddhas of the Future Star Constellation Eon, also known as Gathering the Great Merits of All Buddhas
Appended to the Kaiyuan Catalog by the Liang Dynasty
Those who cultivate goodness attain blessings, while those who do evil reap misfortune; the principle is clear, yet few believe and understand it.
Having been born together in this world of the five turbidities and evil, the five aggregates, afflictions, and three poisons are rampant, and the cycle of birth and death has no end.
In the past, when the Buddha was in the world, the number of people was as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, but now it has gradually dwindled, with not even one in ten thousand remaining.
Why is this so?
Those who do good are few, while those who do evil are many. After death, they fall into the three evil paths and become fish, insects, or animals, and no longer obtain a human body.
Therefore, the Lotus Sutra says:
The three evil paths are filled, and the number of gods and humans decreases.
The end of the eon is not far off, and the long decline is lamentable.

Therefore, the TathÄgata teaches and transforms according to the circumstances, encouraging kindness and goodness, not begrudging his body and life, diligently practicing with vigor, and thus able to attain liberation.
The brief effort of paying homage can eliminate the offenses of immeasurable eons.
When offenses are extinguished and blessings arise, one attains non-action.
In the future, during the Star Constellation Eon, there will be a thousand Buddhas appearing in the world, with these names.

If someone hears their names, single-mindedly pays homage, and does not give rise to laziness, they will certainly attain nirvÄá¹‡a, forever leaving behind the sufferings of the three evil paths and birth and death, peacefully abiding in kindness and patience, and fully endowed with much learning.

If one is able to uphold and recite this, then one will certainly encounter the thousand Buddhas, eradicate the grave offenses of birth and death accumulated over immeasurable asaá¹ƒkhyeya eons, attain the samÄdhi of the Buddhas' spiritual powers, and unobstructed eloquence.

The various great Dharma gates, dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gates, all scriptures and various kinds of wisdom, speaking the Dharma as appropriate without deceiving oneself, leaving behind fame and profit and harboring no jealousy, practicing the six ways of harmony;
Single-mindedly upholding without losing this condition.
One who practices like this will quickly attain supreme, perfect enlightenment.

If any sons or daughters of good family hear the names of these Buddha-World-Honored Ones, joyfully believe and enjoy them, uphold and recite them without slander, or be able to write them down, explain them to others, or be able to create and establish their images, or be able to make offerings of incense, flowers, music, and praise the Buddha's merits, and sincerely bow to them, it is superior to using the precious treasures and pure maá¹‡i jewels filling the Buddha lands of the ten directions, accumulating up to the Brahma Heaven, and making offerings for a hundred thousand eons.

These sons and daughters of good family have already made offerings to these TathÄgatas in the past. The merits they will attain in their future lives will be inexhaustible until they become Buddhas. They will all receive predictions from the Buddhas of the Worthy Kalpa.

Wherever they are reborn, they will always encounter the Three Jewels, be born in the Buddha lands, have complete six senses, not fall into the eight difficulties, and quickly attain the thirty-two marks and eighty minor characteristics. If they can prostrate with their five limbs to the ground and make offerings, and say with their own mouths:
I now make universal obeisance to all Buddhas of the ten directions and three times.
After making offerings to a thousand Buddhas, they can then get up. The blessings and merits they attain are as explained above.

Upholding these merits, they wish to share them with all sentient beings in the five paths. Those without permanence will be born in the land of AmitÄyus Buddha and make great vows to cause all sentient beings to be born in that land.

After being born in that land, their bodies will have the excellent characteristics and wisdom and eloquence like the World-Honored AmitÄbha Buddha. The rewards they attain will also be like the World-Honored One.
On the 28th page, the 7th line from the right, the 3rd buddha in the distant north, and on the same page, the 19th line from the left, the 1st buddha in the manifest north, may be in error.
